original_title: Sri Lanka chamber supports 105 paramedic ambulances with Rs525mn
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Ceylon Chamber of Commerce said its member firms and individuals have raised 525 million rupees to support 105 ambulances operated by the ‘Suwa Seriya’ paramedic service.

“The adoption of these Suwa Seriya ambulances will undoubtedly save lives and provide much-needed healthcare access to remote areas,” Chairman of the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce, Vish Govindasamy said.
The Suwa Seriya service was initiated using a grant by India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi, following a suggestion by legislator Harsha de Silva and then Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

“The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce remains committed to facilitating partnerships between the corporate sector and social causes that contribute to the well-being of the Sri Lankan community,” the chamber said.
“This adoption of Suwa Seriya ambulances is a testament to its efforts to drive positive change and create a meaningful impact on the lives of people in need.” (Colombo/ April19/2023)
